Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: சிறுமையும் செல்லாத் துனியும் வறுமையும்இல்லாயின் வெல்லும் படை.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: An army can triumph (over its foes) if it is free from diminution; irremediable aversion and poverty.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A powerful, victorious army ('வெல்லும் படை') is shown standing triumphant on a battlefield.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The source of their victory is shown by what they lack. Three monstrous, defeated beasts lie dead at their feet, representing the three evils they are free from.
Layered_Composition.Background: The three beasts are: a small, dwindling creature for 'diminution' ('சிறுமை'); a hateful, spiteful creature for 'aversion/mutiny' ('செல்லாத் துனி'); and a gaunt, skeletal creature for 'poverty' ('வறுமை'). The army is victorious because it was never afflicted by these internal weaknesses.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: An army's victory is guaranteed if it is free from the three internal corruptions: dwindling numbers, internal dissent, and poverty.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The personification of the three weaknesses as defeated monsters is a clear and powerful metaphor. The army is not shown fighting them; rather, their victory over the external enemy was possible because these internal enemies were already absent.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A bright, victorious, golden light illuminates the triumphant army. The defeated monsters are dark, ugly, and decaying. The palette is one of clear victory and health.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A heroic wide shot of the victorious army standing over the corpses of the three symbolic monsters.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with detailed and monstrous designs for the three defeated evils.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: High fantasy art, symbolic battle aftermath.

Flux_Optimized_Prompt.Negative_Prompt: defeated army, happy monsters, text artifacts, cartoonish beasts.
